Vortex Workbench configuration template for two step calibration of the head tracking relative the 3D TV connected to the computer Vortex at LiU.
1. helmet mount calibration, and 2. tracker registration
## Calibration of Helmet Mount
The points in the first calibration step represent left lateral wall of orbit, right lateral wall of orbit and chin of the wearer, respectively. Adjust the numbers to match the calibration target.
.\bin\gm-tracker-registration ^ --output-template urn:gramods:config/se.liu.vortex.workbench-ActiveTV-template.xml ^ --output-file se.liu.vortex.workbench-ActiveTV-template-step2.xml ^ --config urn:gramods:config/se.liu.mit.vive.calibration-tracker-relative.xml ^ --point -0.05,0,0 ^ --point +0.05,0,0 ^ --point 0,-0.12,0
## Tracker to Display Registration
The subsequent calibration of display coordinates is done by marking the monitor corners, in clockwise order, starting at the lower left corner. Make sure that the tracker is visible by at least one of the base stations, if optical tracking is used. Also, adjust the coordinates of the corners (`--point`) if necessary.
.\bin\gm-tracker-registration ^ --output-template se.liu.vortex.workbench-ActiveTV-template-step2.xml ^ --output-file se.liu.vortex.workbench-ActiveTV.xml ^ --config urn:gramods:config/output-normal-to-console.xml ^ --config urn:gramods:config/se.liu.mit.vive.calibration-tracker.xml ^ --point -0.210,+0.148,0 ^ --point +0.210,+0.148,0 ^ --point -0.210,-0.148,0 ^ --point +0.210,-0.148,0
